member.name: M:iText.Barcodes.BarcodeQRCode.SetHints(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{iText.Barcodes.Qrcode.EncodeHintType,System.Object})
member.param: modifiers to change the way the barcode is created. They can be EncodeHintType.ERROR_CORRECTION and EncodeHintType.CHARACTER_SET. For EncodeHintType.ERROR_CORRECTION the values can be ErrorCorrectionLevel.L, M, Q, H. For EncodeHintType.CHARACTER_SET the values are strings and can be Cp437, Shift_JIS and ISO-8859-1 to ISO-8859-16. You can also use UTF-8, but correct behaviour is not guaranteed as Unicode is not supported in QRCodes. The default value is ISO-8859-1.

member.name: M:iText.Barcodes.Qrcode.MaskUtil.ApplyMaskPenaltyRule1(iText.Barcodes.Qrcode.ByteMatrix)
member.summary: Apply mask penalty rule 1 and return the penalty.
member.remarks: Apply mask penalty rule 1 and return the penalty. Find repetitive cells with the same color and give penalty to them. Example: 00000 or 11111.
member.param: ByteMatrix to apply the penalty rule to

member.name: M:iText.Barcodes.Qrcode.MaskUtil.ApplyMaskPenaltyRule2(iText.Barcodes.Qrcode.ByteMatrix)
member.summary: Apply mask penalty rule 2 and return the penalty.
member.remarks: Apply mask penalty rule 2 and return the penalty. Find 2x2 blocks with the same color and give penalty to them.
member.param: ByteMatrix to apply the penalty rule to

member.name: M:iText.Barcodes.Qrcode.MaskUtil.ApplyMaskPenaltyRule3(iText.Barcodes.Qrcode.ByteMatrix)
member.summary: Apply mask penalty rule 3 and return the penalty.
member.remarks: Apply mask penalty rule 3 and return the penalty. Find consecutive cells of 00001011101 or 10111010000, and give penalty to them. If we find patterns like 000010111010000, we give penalties twice (i.e. 40 * 2).
member.param: ByteMatrix to apply the penalty rule to

member.name: M:iText.Barcodes.Qrcode.MaskUtil.ApplyMaskPenaltyRule4(iText.Barcodes.Qrcode.ByteMatrix)
member.summary: Apply mask penalty rule 4 and return the penalty.
member.remarks: Apply mask penalty rule 4 and return the penalty. Calculate the ratio of dark cells and give penalty if the ratio is far from 50%. It gives 10 penalty for 5% distance. Examples: - 0% => 100 - 40% => 20 - 45% => 10 - 50% => 0 - 55% => 10 - 55% => 20 - 100% => 100
member.param: Bytematrix to apply the rule to

member.summary: Return the mask bit for "getMaskPattern" at "x" and "y".
member.remarks: Return the mask bit for "getMaskPattern" at "x" and "y". See 8.8 of JISX0510:2004 for mask pattern conditions.
member.returns: the mask bit at that position

member.remarks: Embed version information if need be. For version < 7, version info is not necessary On success, the matrix is modified See 8.10 of JISX0510:2004 (p.47) for how to embed version information.

member.name: M:iText.Barcodes.Qrcode.MatrixUtil.EmbedDataBits(iText.Barcodes.Qrcode.BitVector,System.Int32,iText.Barcodes.Qrcode.ByteMatrix)
member.summary: Embed "dataBits" using "getMaskPattern".
member.remarks: Embed "dataBits" using "getMaskPattern". On success, the matrix is modified For debugging purposes, it skips masking process if "getMaskPattern" is -1. See 8.7 of JISX0510:2004 (p.38) for how to embed data bits.
member.param: data bits to embed in the QR code
masking pattern to apply to the data bits
Byte matrix representing the QR code

member.name: M:iText.Barcodes.Qrcode.MatrixUtil.FindMSBSet(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the position of the most significant bit set (to one) in the "value".
member.remarks: Return the position of the most significant bit set (to one) in the "value". The most significant bit is position 32. If there is no bit set, return 0. Examples: - findMSBSet(0) => 0 - findMSBSet(1) => 1 - findMSBSet(255) => 8
member.returns: the position of the most significant bit set to 1 in the bit-representation of value
